review_title: Challenging Environment for Faculty and Staff
pros:
Helping our students is rewarding and you definitely know you're helping people in this university. 
Many talented people are devoted to the mission of education and service.
cons:
There have been no raises in 3 years and salaries are lower than other comparable colleges in the state. 
Athletics is funded almost entirely by money generated by academics, while athletic scholarships are funded by charging fees to students. Academics suffers under this funding model, and students take a financial hit that only benefits a few hundred student athletes.

review_title: Glassdoor says describe my experience at SFASU in one sentence:  LAME...is the word I would use.
job_title: Technical Support Specialist II in Nacogdoches, TX
pros: If you like alot of days off/holidays as opposed to corporate employment, then you'll like that feature.
cons: SFASU closes for Christmas and makes it mandatory for employess to use some of their own time to cover the absence, since the State of Texas only allows a certain number of free holidays.  SFASU schedules holidays in excess of this, and makes the employees utilize their accumulated leave time to cover the excess days off.  So basically you get told when and where to use your leave.  Is that really leave time????

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Nacogdoches, TX
pros: The work was very rewarding and part of my graduate studies so that was really nice. The Forestry department has great professors and research is valued.
cons: Stephen F. Austin provides much less benefits to employees than other places I've worked. Even professors pay heavily for parking permits. I only got to use the gym because I was a student and even then I only got to use it certain times of the year. I went to the gym at least 4 times during my career only to be turned away for different reasons (Sticker out of date, closed for training, wrong summer semester because I was registered in one semester instead of different one). Really disappointing the way the college treats you. My research fellowship is the reason I was paid exceptionally well and had health insurance, that is not to be expected as a regular research assistant.

pros: Easy going work environment, not much will ever be expected of you outside of your job description.
cons: Many mid level managers are racist and creep on young women on campus. Lots of ridiculous work policies that make it hard to be productive, no room for advancement if you aren't hired to an executive position, upper management often breaks their own rules and spend lots of budget money on themselves. Example: director of our department thought it was necessary to have an office chair that cost the University more than $500. Also have witnessed my head manager have my boss build stuff for his personal house using University materials. Tldr: corrupt management all around.

pros: The best part of working at Stephen F. Austin is being able to help students trough the stressful times of college. A lot of management care and help you work around your class schedule as well.
cons: The worst part about working at Stephen F. Austin is the pay. Since you are a college students and the jobs are in high demand you mostly get paid minimum wage.

job_title: Marketing Student Assistant in Nacogdoches, TX
pros: I absolutely loved working here. I left because I graduated and this is a student position. Everyone I worked with is wonderful. I learned so much about marketing and advertising. It was nice to have real-world experience before I started my career. Since it was a student position, my hours were very flexible. The pay was good for the position.
cons: Big job for just one student, but they have since hired two and split the responsibilities.

pros: The faculty are friendly and professional. They go to great lengths to accommodate varying lifestyles so that employees feel comfortable and welcomed. It is also located in the quiet town of Nacogdoches, Texas. The traffic is minimal, and the people are terrific.
cons: If you want to get away for the weekend, there is a minimum 2 hours in a car to get to any where not resembling a small town.

review_title: Feels great to work with the community at SFA, all like a family
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Nacogdoches, TX
pros: team work, all assist you if you need assistance any time. Just ask and get a positive response. if you need time for your family you'll most likely will get it.
cons: salaries are just fine for RAs and TAs. not many benefits because you have to pay for benefits which is expensive for student workers and grad assistants.

review_title: Beautiful Campus, Friendly People, Low Pay
job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Boca Raton, FL
pros: Nacogdoches is a great little college town, and the faculty and students are generally friendly.  SFA has a beautiful campus and you have quite a bit of flexibility in how you do your job.
cons: The students are low level (lower than other universities I've taught at) and the pay is quite low as well.

pros: I worked 3 part time jobs for the Department of Physics and Astronomy. By the time I had completed my degree, I had become very close with the faculty and other staff and it was very hard to leave; if you are good to them, they treat you like family.
cons: Long hours of grading while working towards a difficult degree. Time management is key.

pros: The hours are very flexible and allow you to put your education requirements first. the supervisors are very knowledgeable in their respective fields
cons: Only working 20 hours a week maximum at minimum wage is ok for students who need just a little extra spending money. However for those like myself who need to pay bills like rent and and insurance, it is not enough.

review_title: Nice people in a flawed system
pros: Most everyone is very congenial and will be more than happy to assist with any problems you might have. State benefits.
cons: The system is very bureaucratic, as one would expect, and this leads to institutionalized inefficiency and entrenchment on the part of long-term employees.

review_title: Working at SFA as a Student
pros: You get the holidays off that the university has off, and bosses are usually lenient with time off for studying or other student related things.
cons:
Usually no room for a pay raise (only some of the departments will give one).
There is no "official" sick or vacation time so it's solely something to work out with your supervisor.

review_title: Great place to work at with a great atmosphere and professionals.
pros: Stephen f Austin university is a great place to work at because the university has a great flexible work schedule, benefits, and professionals working together
cons: Some of the challenges working at Stephen f Austin university is the fact that the school is located in Nacogdoches TX

pros: I have worked with extremely nice and patient people, a very positive environment, and the other student assistants were some of the best friends I’ve made while at SFA.
cons: I don’t have any negative experiences to list!

pros: Best job I've ever had. Learning so much and everyone is always willing to help each other. Great intro to the IT workforce.
cons: Wish SFA paid us more. Student workers get minimum wage but I think we should at least get more than that. For what we do.

review_title: Good learning experience, however, I am very ambitious and needed more of a challenge
pros: Good learning Experience, Great training.
cons: Not much upward movement, and I was not willing to wait 20 years to get a promotion.

pros: Great people!  The lab coordinator is awesome.  Everyone always has an open door if you have any problems or need any help.  The experience was amazing.
cons: Not a lot of money.  But it is college.

pros: Good employer for the local area. There aren’t many other choices.
cons: Don’t move here for a professional job. Upper admin is incompetent and hostile to faculty. The library dropped journal subscriptions and bought a virtual reality suite. Our health insurance costs more and covers less every year.
